page.title: 09ECOLOGY AROUND NENTHEAD
page.content: The altitude <432-490metres above S.L> determines the precipitation <1,500mm> and the mean annual temperature of 7 degrees C. The rough pasture and moorland surrounding the village remains wild and unspoilt.The landscape consists of high plateaus and gently undulating ridges.Vegetation on the highest ground is saturated moorland from whence comes the source of the major rivers.Here is blanket bog and peat with a cover of grasses,heather,bog, mosses and cotton grass. Peat erosion on the fells is caused by natural weathering,moor burning and prolonged sheep grazing. Golden plover,curlews,buzzards,lap- wings,eagles and herons may be seen by walkers on the fells.On the highest ground grouse are plentiful.
